titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)
Chapter 51 – The truthfulness and the repayment of the entrustments
THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/176)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) يَا بَنِي عَبْدِ الْمُطَّلِبِ إِنَّكُمْ لَنْ تَسَعُوا النَّاسَ بِأَمْوَالِكُمْ فَالْقَوْهُمْ بِطَلَاقَةِ الْوَجْهِ وَ حُسْنِ الْبِشْرِ .
وَ رَوَاهُ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ جَدِّهِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِلَّا أَنَّهُ قَالَ يَا بَنِي هَاشِمٍ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Al Hassan Bin Al Husayn who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘O sons of Abdul Muttalib<sup>as</sup>! You will never be equal to the people in their wealth, therefore meet them with the relaxed face and goodly cheerfulness’.
And it is reported from Al Qasim Bin Yahya, from his grandfather Al Hassan Bin Rashid,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, (same as above) except that he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Clan of Hashim<sup>as</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Hassan ibn al-Husayn who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘The Messenger of Allah said, “O children of ‘Abd al- Muttalib, you cannot reach the level of people with your wealth. but you should meet them with openness and a delightful face.””’ He has narrated also from al-Qasim ibn Yahya from his grandfather al-Hassan ibn Rashid from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) a similar Hadith except that it says, “O children of Hashim.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/177)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: ثَلَاثٌ مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِوَاحِدَةٍ مِنْهُنَّ أَوْجَبَ اللَّهُ لَهُ الْجَنَّةَ الْإِنْفَاقُ مِنْ إِقْتَارٍ وَ الْبِشْرُ لِجَمِيعِ الْعَالَمِ وَ الْإِنْصَافُ مِنْ نَفْسِهِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Usman Bin Isa, from Sama’at Bin Mihran,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Three (things), the one who goes to Allah<sup>azwj</sup> with one of these, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> would Obligate the Paradise for him – the spending from poverty, and the cheerfulness to the entirety of the world, and the justice from himself’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama’a ibn Mehran from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘If Allah grants to a person one of three things, He will make paradise necessary for him. They are: To give charity in poverty, to have delightful appearance in all people and to exercise justice even against one’s own self.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (178/ 8)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: أَتَى رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) رَجُلٌ فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ أَوْصِنِي فَكَانَ فِيمَا أَوْصَاهُ أَنْ قَالَ الْقَ أَخَاكَ بِوَجْهٍ مُنْبَسِطٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Mahboubn, from Hisham Bin Salim, from Abu Baseer,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘A man came over to Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup>, so he said, ‘O Rasool-Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup>! Advise me’. So, among what he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> advised him was that he<sup style="font-weight: normal">saww</sup> said: ‘Meet your brother with a cheerful face’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn Mahbub from Hisham ibn Salim from abu Basir from abu Ja’far (a.s.) who has said the following: “Once a man came to the Messenger of Allah, saying, ‘O Messenger of Allah, confer upon me good advice.’ Of the advice given to him was this: ‘Meet your brethren (fellow human beings) with open and delightful face.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل كالحسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/178)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لَهُ مَا حَدُّ حُسْنِ الْخُلُقِ قَالَ تُلِينُ جَنَاحَكَ وَ تُطِيبُ كَلَامَكَ وَ تَلْقَى أَخَاكَ بِبِشْرٍ حَسَنٍ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ibn Mahboub, from one of his companions, from Abu Abdullahasws, said,
‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What is the limit of the good manners?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Relax your arms, and be good in your speech, and meet your brother with goodly cheerfulness’.
en.sarwar: 4. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from ibn Mahbub from certain individuals of his people who has said the following: “Once I asked abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) ‘What is the limit of excellent moral behavior?’ The Imam said, ‘It is to be relaxed (kindhearted), to have sweet expressions and to meet one’s fellow human beings with a delightful face.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: كالصحيح موقو ف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/179)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ رِبْعِيٍّ عَنْ فُضَيْلٍ قَالَ

text: صَنَائِعُ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَ حُسْنُ الْبِشْرِ يَكْسِبَانِ الْمَحَبَّةَ وَ يُدْخِلَانِ الْجَنَّةَ وَ الْبُخْلُ وَ عُبُوسُ الْوَجْهِ يُبْعِدَانِ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَ يُدْخِلَانِ النَّارَ .

en.hubeali: From him, from his father, from Hammad, from Rabie, from Fuzayl who said,

‘The good works and the goodly cheerfulness both amass the love and cause to enter the Paradise; and the stinginess and a frown face both cause remoteness from Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and cause to enter the Fire’.
en.sarwar: 5. It is narrated from him (narrator of the Hadith above) from his father from Hammad from Rib’I from Fudayl who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far or abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) has said, ‘Doing lawful favors to others and having a delightful appearance earns love and lead one to paradise. Stinginess and a frowning face lead one away from Allah and into fire (of hell).”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/180)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) حُسْنُ الْبِشْرِ يَذْهَبُ بِالسَّخِيمَةِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Usman Bin Isa, from Sama’at,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Musa<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The goodly cheerfulness does away with the grudges’.
en.sarwar: 6. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama’a from abu al-Hassan Musa (a.s.) who has said the following: “The Messenger of Allah has said, ‘Delightful appearance removes ill will.’”
